news.title: Many in Hospice Don't Get Medical Visit in Last 2 Days of Life: Study: MedlinePlus
news.summary: MONDAY, Feb. 8, 2016 (HealthDay News) -- In the last two days before dying, many hospice patients cared for at home or in a nursing home were not seen by a doctor, nurse or social worker, a new study finds.

news.title: Hospice Patients Not Always Seen During Last Days
news.summary: Action Points Routine home care visits for hospice patients during the last 2 days of life varied widely by race, geographic location, and day of the week.

news.title: Variation in hospice visits for Medicare patients in last 2 days of life
news.summary: Medicare patients in hospice care were less likely to be visited by professional staff in the last two days of life if they were black, dying on a Sunday or receiving care in a nursing home, according to an article published online by JAMA Internal…

news.title: Not All Hospices Provide the Same Quality of Care
news.summary: The quality of care and services delivered by hospice agencies in the United States varies, according to new research.

news.title: Hospice patients get too little care in last days of life, study says
news.summary: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9 (UPI) -- One in eight hospice patients do not see a doctor, nurse, or social worker during their last two days of life, researchers for the federal agency responsible for the end-of-life programs found in a recent study.
